intro: Distephana quadriglandulosa, commonly known as the four-gland daphne, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has a woody stem with four prominent glands on its leaves, which are a distinguishing feature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
